intro: Glyphotaenium, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the Americas and includes species such as Glyphotaenium parvifolium, which is found in Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of Glyphotaenium make it an important species in ecological and medicinal contexts.
